Method Detail

onMessage

public void onMessage(MessageEvent event)
               throws Exception
Easy and recommended way to handle events: Override respective methods in ListenerAdapter.

This example shows how to work with the waitFor ability of PircBotX. Follow the inline comments for how this works

*WARNING:* This example requires using a Threaded listener manager (this is PircBotX's default)

Overrides:
onMessage in class ListenerAdapter
Parameters:
event - A MessageEvent
Throws:
Exception - If any Exceptions might be thrown, throw them up and let the ListenerManager handle it. This can be removed though if not needed

onEvent

public void onEvent(Event rawevent)
             throws Exception
Older way to handle events. We are given a generic event and must cast to the event type that we want. This is helpful for when you need to funnel all events into a single method, eg logging

This also shows the other way to send messages: With PircBotX's send* methods. These should be used when the respond() method of the event doesn't send the message to where you want it to go.

*WARNING:* If you are extending ListenerAdapter and implementing Listener in the same class (as this does) you *must* call super.onEvent(event); otherwise none of the methods in ListenerAdapter will get called!

Specified by:
onEvent in interface Listener
Overrides:
onEvent in class ListenerAdapter
Parameters:
rawevent - A generic event
Throws:
Exception - If any Exceptions might be thrown, throw them up and let the ListenerManager handle it. This can be removed though if not needed

main

public static void main(String[] args)
